comment:+comment-1751874375575:title: Main fields
comment:+comment-1751874375575:content:
In most cases, you only need to configure these three fields to run everything properly.
- `source_file`: The original EPUB file to be translated
- `translated_file`: The location to save the translated EPUB file (if left blank, it will be saved in `session_dir`)
- `language`: The target language for the translation
comment:+comment-1751874833250:title: Custom prompt
comment:+comment-1751874833250:content: The `prompt` field can be filled with prompts to provide necessary information for the LLM to translate books. For example, you can enter standardized glossaries and character names. Simply describe and inform the LLM in natural language.
comment:+comment-1751874949570:title: Output field
comment:+comment-1751874949570:content: `translated_file` The save path of the translated file.
comment:+comment-1751875005817:title: extra field
comment:+comment-1751875005817:content:
If you do not wish to modify the following fields, simply keep their original values.

- `max_chunk_tokens`: When translating in segments, this limits the maximum number of tokens per segment. Due to the nature of LLMs, it is impossible to input an entire book into a large language model for translation at once. Therefore, the book will be divided into segments and submitted to the LLM. This parameter is used to limit the maximum length of each segment (measured in tokens).
- `threads`: The number of concurrent translation requests. If you feel the translation is too slow, you can increase this value. However, it is recommended not to exceed 16 concurrent threads, as this may trigger rate limiting by the LLM provider.
- `retry_times`: The number of consecutive failures for the same segment before declaring it a failure.
- `retry_interval_seconds`: The number of seconds to wait before retrying after a failed attempt.
comment:+comment-1751875472639:title: Interrupted interpretation
comment:+comment-1751875472639:content: When translating the same book, if you actively interrupt the process or it is interrupted due to network issues, the progress you have made will not be lost. After clicking "Run" to continue, you can resume translating from where you left off last time.
